story:
Once upon a time, in a lush green forest in the heart of Sri Lanka, there lived a kind-hearted elephant named Ella. Ella was not like any other elephant in the herd; she had a special gift. She had the ability to understand and speak the language of humans.

One day, a little boy named Samir wandered into the forest while playing near the riverbank. Samir was from a nearby village, and he often came to the forest to observe the animals and birds. But this time, he strayed too far and found himself lost.

As night fell, Samir became scared and began to cry. Hearing the boy's sobs, Ella approached him cautiously. Seeing the young human child in distress, Ella spoke softly, "Why are you crying, little one? I am here to help you."

Samir was taken aback. He couldn't believe his ears. An elephant was speaking to him in his language!

"I-I am lost. I cannot find my way back home," stammered Samir.

Ella comforted the boy, "Do not worry, dear Samir. I will bring you back to your village by first light. But for now, come, let us find you a place to rest."

Ella then led Samir to a cozy spot, protected by the branches of a giant banyan tree. She gently nudged him to lie down and then wrapped her strong trunk around him as a makeshift blanket.

As Samir drifted off to sleep, he felt safe and cared for in the presence of the gentle Ella. In his dreams, he saw himself riding on Ella's back, guiding her through the forest with its towering trees, sparkling streams, and chirping birds.

When Samir awoke, he found himself back in the safety of his village, surrounded by cheering villagers. Ella, standing a few feet away, smiled at the boy and then disappeared silently into the forest.

From that day on, Samir and Ella shared a deep bond of friendship and love. And whenever Samir ventured into the forest, he could always hear Ella's soft voice, guiding him and watching over him from afar.

And so the story of the compassionate elephant and the grateful boy became a timeless tale in Samir's village. It was a reminder to all that with kindness and understanding, even the most unlikely acquaintances could become family.

Now, my dear son, as you close your eyes and drift off to sleep, remember that the world is full of wonders and magic waiting to be discovered. Goodnight, my dear; have sweet dreams and an even better tomorrow.
